Trump's Gaza peace plan, a fragile compromise with few obligations for Israel
subhead: The 20-point plan unveiled by the US president received the backing of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. If Hamas agrees, the conflict would end immediately and the hostages would have to be released by October 2. Israel's military withdrawal would not be subject to a binding timetable.

Asia's Gen Z rises up against entrenched political elites
subhead: Since 2022, young people in Sri Lanka, Bangladesh and Nepal have led a wave of uprisings to demand radical change, united by a common cause: frustration with politicians' corruption and self-granted privileges.

title: Drone incursions: 'Russia is testing the resolve of democratic societies to respond to its threats'
subhead: Researcher Nicolas Tenzer argues that recent drone overflights in European airspace and GPS jamming are not only meant to test Europe's technical capabilities, but primarily to destabilize it.

title: Anesthesia's remarkable journey since the 19th century
subhead: An exhibition at the Museum of the History of Medicine in Paris traces the saga of this discipline, from its beginnings to the major advances that transformed medical practice.

title: Paris struggles to curb car traffic without alienating road users
subhead: Since 2020, Paris has undertaken a series of street redesigns aimed at restricting motorized traffic. These 'traffic plans' have been adjusted district by district, drawing heavy criticism from the opposition.

Svalbard, the fastest-warming place on Earth
subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (1/6). The Norwegian archipelago has warmed by 4°C over the past 30 years. Landslides and thawing permafrost threaten the population, whose way of life is highly greenhouse gas-intensive.

title: The day Sarkozy learned he was going to prison
subhead: Nicolas Sarkozy will become the first former president of the French Republic to sleep behind bars after being convicted of criminal conspiracy, in the case of alleged Libyan financing of his 2007 presidential campaign.

title: 'Zucman tax': The great fear of France's ultra-rich
subhead: Amid budget negotiations, the idea of a tax on the wealth of the ultra-rich is provoking an outcry from those affected, even though it is widely supported by the left and backed by public opinion.
